text:
<@U048C858Y94> Hi James,

I have another question. In order to start creating the custom email template, from where can I provide the CSS codes of our current drag and drop email templates that we would like our developer to use and build the new custom template?

Thank you

If you send yourself a a copy of your email, you can download the .eml file from your inbox provider (Gmail, Apple Mail, etc.) Easiest to do that on a desktop browser. Then you can open the .eml file with a service like <http://Parcel.io|Parcel.io>. Your email code will then be displayed there and you can share that with your developer.
